title: Zed's 49% Win Rate
body:
So I came across this thought, about Zed being "49% Win Rate" and "Balanced and can't get direct nerfs". I got to thinking, he's banned in 90% of games, who even has the experience to play him? Half the people playing him are probably first time people picking him just because OP, that's probably tanking his Win Rate. Then I thought, what is his win rate for high games played? In Plat+ Games?

http://champion.gg/champion/Zed

15 Games Played: 47.12%

125+ Games Played: 54.12%

{{champion:268}} : "I wonder where I've seen this before."
(For reference, Azir who is getting nerfed, has a 125+ Win Rate of 53.85%)

(Edit: I'm kind of fascinated by the downvotes. I'm explicitly taking data from Plat+ Ranked. Azir was explicitly nerfed for this reason. If there's somewhere I'm wrong, I'd like to hear it instead of having to assume it's a few salty Zed mains trying to downvote quietly.)

I'd like proof of this because kassadin was beyond op more so then zed , his ult did 400 damage on like 1 stack at full stacking up to the point of one shot, he also had a point and click silence and his ap ratios were insanely high , not to mention he got mana back for every time he autod instead of just when you use it

Kass was OP because his mobility and damage were too high, despite having a garbage early game.

If you remove the garbage early game and replace with completely safe and reliable laning, it sounds remarkably similar to Zed's case.
Zed takes a little more practice than Kass does, but yeah, he does need toning down in a few places.

Removing the unneeded ghost on his ult.

The bonus AD ratio on W that only effectively buffs his auto attacks when he already has his passive (abilities could be compensated with ratio buffs relevant to what the passive offered)

The CDR on W for landing E that accomplishes nothing for his core gameplay, and only adds unnecessary safety. 

The 90% slow on E*2, that could easily be reduced to 60% total (30% base + 30% shadow) without detracting any real power away from his current patterns, while granting him a far less oppressive slow. 

____________________________________________________________________________________________

You mean like addressing these things first, rather than everyone screaming to gut him? lol

I'm more for tuning his mechanics to be more risk/reward.

Like his ult shadow.  What if it were locked behind the death mark, unless you proc it (the shuriken appears above your targets head to show the death mark will kill them) you cannot jump back to your ult shadow. 

Or his W bonus AD, what if it was lost when W was on cooldown?  Wouldn't affect his early game much, but it would have a pretty noticeable impact on his late game.

That first thing would make him so ridiculously feast or famine during teamfights. It means that either you have enough damage to get the target into kill zone and get out, or you don't and you just get blown up.

And to account for a feast or famine champion where famine makes him just useless, the feast case has to be insanely strong.
That is already how Zed functions in teamfights though. He goes in and hopes he can kill his target before he dies/gets CC'ed. Nothing changes here.
i can agree with removing the bonus ad ratio on w, and possibly the e. The rest i dont agree with.

Mmmh yeah, it was extremely stupid how Kass just jumped all around the map, being uncatchable while roaming for every kill he could get, BUT you could shut him down early game if you punished him hard in lane. If you're not an explicit Zed counter it becomes almost impossible to deny him farm, which leads to Zed almost always having the gold he needs to get some early kills. There's no part that feels rewarding when playing against Zed if you aren't 1000AP Veigar just instadeleting him.
Kass's laning phase wasn't nearly as bad as people make it out to have been. Sure he could be punished but that silence and passive made it difficult for most ap champs pre-6.

I played alot of Pantheon during this time and also took him mid to counter Kass during early game. That worked pretty well, of course there were a lot less super-mobile champs or AD champs in the mid lane, but it wasn't impossible to take Kass down, especially since there were alot of sheeple just playing him "cuz free elo". Zed is maybe not as near to being super imbalanced, but he's pretty close regarding how annoying he's to deal with.
My problem isn't really Zed's level of power (a little bit of course, since I play ADC quite often), but just the way he works and how it feels playing against him. Even if I win against Zed it often doesn't feel good encountering, while there are champs that are way more imbalanced I still don't feel like they're as problematic as Zed (subjectively, ingame).

If you look at the high skill required champions across the board, they need to have an overall 45% win rate to be close to balanced. 49% win rate on Zed is like a 58% win rate on a normal champ.
